Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Father James P. Hayes, St. Andrews R.C. Church, Cardinal Hayes Place, New York, NY  10007.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Vann.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Father James P. Hayes, St. Andrews R.C. Church, Cardinal Hayes Place, New York, NY  10007.

Council Member Vann moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
Resolution calling for a change of policy in Iraq and the strategic withdrawal of United States Armed Forces.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: A change of policy in Iraq and the strategic withdrawal of US Armed Forces.

Items.Title: Resolution approving the agreement between the Mayor and Council, attached to this resolution as Appendix A, to spend payments in lieu of taxes only for the purposes, and on the projects or items listed on exhibit i to such agreement, pursuant to local law 73 of 2005.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Pilot Program

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council of the City of New York to hold a hearing to review federal standards and guidelines for determining where to locate traffic control devices and whether they are appropriate for New York City.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Review federal standards and guidelines for determining where  to locate traffic control devices and whether they are appropriate for NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to remove New York City Transit and MTA Bus Company from the control of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA) and transfer control to the city of New York or in the alternative to cede greater decision making authority in the planning and operations of NYCT and MTA Bus Company to the City of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Remove NYC Transit and MTA Bus Company from the control of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA).

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting requirements regarding domestic violence victims.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women's Issues
Items.MatterName: Reporting requirements regarding domestic violence victims.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating an ombudsman position within the New York city department of youth and community development.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Youth Services
Items.MatterName: Creating an ombudsman position within the NYC department of youth and community development.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to disposition of the bodies of deceased indigent individuals.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Disposition of the bodies of deceased indigent individuals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating a program to provide additional assistance to senior citizens who qualify for federal assistance under the Low-Income Home Energy Assistance Program (HEAP).
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Aging
Items.MatterName: Creating a program to provide additional assistance to senior citizens who qualify for federal assistance under the Low-Income Home Energy Assistance Program (HEAP).

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon Governor George Pataki, the New York State Assembly and the New York State Senate to grant New York City the authority to provide a property tax abatement for homeowners 65 years of age or older with annual household incomes of less than $32,400 that would offset the recent property tax rate increase of 18.49 percent.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Property tax abatement for homeowners 65 years of age or older with annual household incomes of less than $32,400,

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to maximize the use of school facility space during non-school hours for community programs and tutoring and enrichment activities, and to allow the use of such facilities for such purposes without charging facility fees.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Youth Services
Items.MatterName: NYC Department of Education to discontinue the practice of charging facility fees for after-school programs.

Items.Title: Resolution finding that enactment of Proposed Int. No. 70-A does not have a significant adverse impact on the environment and is consistent with the state environmental quality review act.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Finding that enactment of Proposed Int. No. 70-A does not have a significant adverse impact on the environment and is consistent with the state environmental quality review act.

Items.Title: Resolution commemorating the life and mourning the death of playwright August Wilson.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Commemorating the life and mourning the death of playwright August Wilson.

Items.Title: Resolution commemorating the life and mourning the death of Nipsey Russell.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Commemorating the life and mourning the death of Nipsey Russell.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the United States government to immediately commence an orderly and rapid withdrawal of United States military personnel from Iraq, and further urging that the financial resources used to prosecute the war be redirected to address the urgent needs of America’s great urban centers and the most vulnerable portions of our population, including in the areas of health, education and homeland security, and calling for a suitable copy of this resolution to be sent to President George W. Bush and members of the New York State Congressional delegation.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Urging the US government to immediately commence an orderly and rapid withdrawal of US military personnel from Iraq.

Items.Title: Resolution determining that Proposed Int. No. 478-A, a Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to enacting the New York city plumbing code based on the 2003 edition of the International Plumbing Code published by the International Code Council and enacting administrative provisions applicable to such New York city plumbing code and to such other codes as may hereafter be enacted by the city based on the 2003 editions of the International Building Code, the International Fuel Gas Code, the International Mechanical Code and the International Residential Code, will not have a significant adverse impact on the environment.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Provide a time frame for the adoption and periodic updating of a modern construction code.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of a temporary fuel-saving program.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Creation of a temporary fuel-saving program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to pedicabs.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Pedicabs

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Requiring a study on the impacts of food waste disposals in commercial establishments.

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Secretary of Veterans Affairs to keep the Veterans Hospitals open, including the Brooklyn site of the New York Harbor VA Health Care System.

Items.MinutesNote:
During the Meeting, the Speaker (Council Member Miller) asked for a moment of silence In Memory of the more than two thousand Americans in the military who lost their lives in Iraq and Afghanistan.  

The Speaker (Council Member Miller) also asked for a moment of silence In Memory of civil rights pioneer Rosa Parks.
